title: Sri Lanka February 2026
description: An 8-day journey through Sri Lanka ‚Äî ancient rock fortresses, misty tea country, the famous hill-country train, and colonial Galle Fort by the sea.

activities.title: Flight JD487 ‚Äî Beijing (PKX) to Colombo
activities.description: Julian's outbound flight from Beijing Daxing. Direct flight.
activities.tips: Bring a good book ‚Äî it's a long flight.

activities.title: Flight CX489 ‚Äî Taipei (TPE) to Hong Kong
activities.description: Ryvn's outbound leg. Cathay Pacific CX489 from Taoyuan to Hong Kong.

activities.title: Arrive Hong Kong ‚Äî First Class Lounge
activities.description: 7-hour layover at Hong Kong International Airport. Relax in the Cathay Pacific First Class Lounge.

activities.title: Julian lands at Colombo (CMB)
activities.description: Arrive at Bandaranaike International Airport. Pick up local SIM card and arrange transfer to hotel.
activities.tips: Get a Dialog or Mobitel SIM at the airport arrivals hall ‚Äî fast data for cheap.

activities.title: Transfer to Negombo
activities.description: Short 15-minute drive from the airport to the hotel in Negombo.

activities.title: Check in at Jetwing Blue
activities.description: Beachfront hotel right on Negombo Beach. Relax after the long flight.

activities.title: Dinner & Beach Sunset
activities.description: Enjoy fresh seafood at the hotel or walk to a nearby restaurant along Negombo Beach. Catch the sunset over the Indian Ocean.

activities.title: Flight CX611 ‚Äî Hong Kong to Colombo
activities.description: Cathay Pacific CX611. Overnight flight arriving late.

activities.title: Ryvn lands at Colombo (CMB)
activities.description: Late-night arrival at Bandaranaike International Airport. Transfer to hotel in Negombo.

activities.title: Drive to Sigiriya
activities.description: Scenic 4-hour drive through the Sri Lankan countryside from Negombo to the Cultural Triangle.

activities.title: Sigiriya Rock Fortress
activities.description: Climb the ancient rock fortress ‚Äî a UNESCO World Heritage Site built in the 5th century. 1,200 steps to the top with stunning views of the surrounding jungle and plains.
activities.tips: Go early to avoid the midday heat. Bring water. The frescoes halfway up are incredible.

activities.title: Lunch
activities.description: Lunch near Sigiriya. Try a traditional Sri Lankan rice and curry spread.

activities.title: Check in at Ceylon Breeze Sigiriya
activities.description: Rest and enjoy the pool after the Sigiriya climb.

activities.title: Drive to Kandy
activities.description: 3-hour drive south from Sigiriya through the hill country to Kandy, Sri Lanka's cultural capital.

activities.title: Temple of the Tooth (Sri Dalada Maligawa)
activities.description: Sacred Buddhist temple housing the relic of the tooth of Buddha. One of the most important pilgrimage sites in the Buddhist world.
activities.tips: Dress modestly ‚Äî cover shoulders and knees. Remove shoes before entering.

activities.title: Lunch by Kandy Lake
activities.description: Enjoy lunch with views of the scenic Kandy Lake, right in the heart of the city.

activities.title: Udawattakele Forest Reserve
activities.description: A serene forest sanctuary above the Temple of the Tooth. Great for a peaceful walk among ancient trees, birds, and monkeys.

activities.title: Ceylon Tea Museum
activities.description: Learn about Sri Lanka's famous tea industry in this museum housed in a former tea factory. Includes tea tasting.

activities.title: Check in at Cinnamon Citadel Kandy
activities.description: Riverside hotel with beautiful views of the Mahaweli River.

days.title: Day 4 ‚Äî The Famous Train to Ella

activities.title: Drive to Ambewala Station
activities.description: 2-hour drive from Kandy to Ambewala railway station to catch the famous hill-country train.

activities.title: Train: Ambewala ‚Üí Ella
activities.description: One of the most beautiful train rides in the world. The train winds through lush green tea plantations, crosses the iconic Nine Arches Bridge, and passes through misty mountain tunnels.
activities.location: Sri Lanka Railways ‚Äî Hill Country Line
activities.tips: Sit on the right side for the best views. Hang out by the open doors for the full experience (carefully!). Book 2nd class for open windows.

activities.title: Arrive in Ella
activities.description: Welcome to Ella ‚Äî a small, laid-back mountain town surrounded by tea plantations and waterfalls.

activities.title: Check in at La Casa Bella
activities.description: Settle in for a 2-night stay in Ella.

activities.title: Explore Ella Town
activities.description: Walk around Ella's charming main street. Grab a coffee, browse the shops, and enjoy the mountain views.

activities.title: Tea Estate Visit
activities.description: Visit a working tea estate and factory. See how Ceylon tea is picked, processed, and graded. Includes a tasting session.

activities.title: Nine Arches Bridge
activities.description: Walk to the iconic Nine Arches Bridge ‚Äî a colonial-era stone viaduct set among jungle and tea fields. Watch the train cross if your timing is right.
activities.tips: Trains cross around 9:15am, 11:00am, and 3:30pm ‚Äî check the schedule.

activities.title: Lunch in Ella
activities.description: Plenty of great cafes and restaurants in town. Try a kottu roti or a Sri Lankan curry.

activities.title: Little Adam's Peak
activities.description: Easy 45-minute hike to panoramic views of Ella Gap and the surrounding tea country. One of the best viewpoints in the area.

activities.title: Ravana Falls
activities.description: One of Sri Lanka's widest waterfalls, just a short tuk-tuk ride from Ella center.

activities.title: Transfer to Galle
activities.description: Long but scenic 5-hour drive south from the hill country to the coast. The landscape changes dramatically from mountains to tropical coast.

activities.title: Arrive & Check in at The Fort House
activities.description: Boutique hotel inside the historic Galle Fort walls.

activities.title: Galle Fort Rampart Walk
activities.description: Walk along the 400-year-old Dutch colonial fort walls. Beautiful views of the ocean on both sides, especially at sunset.

activities.title: Dutch Reformed Church
activities.description: One of the oldest Protestant churches in Sri Lanka, dating back to 1755. Beautiful colonial architecture.

activities.title: Explore Galle Fort Streets
activities.description: Wander through the charming streets inside the fort. Art galleries, boutique shops, cafes, and colonial architecture everywhere.

activities.title: Sunset & Dinner at the Fort
activities.description: Watch the sunset from the ramparts, then find a restaurant inside the fort for dinner.

activities.title: Breakfast at the Fort
activities.description: Lazy morning breakfast at the hotel or a nearby cafe inside Galle Fort.

activities.title: Beach Day ‚Äî Unawatuna or Jungle Beach
activities.description: Head to nearby Unawatuna Beach (10 min drive) or the hidden Jungle Beach for a full day of sun, swimming, and relaxation.
activities.tips: Jungle Beach is smaller but more secluded ‚Äî great for snorkeling.

activities.title: Beachside Lunch
activities.description: Fresh seafood and cold drinks with your feet in the sand.

activities.title: Last Evening in Galle
activities.description: Final sunset from the fort ramparts. Soak it all in.

activities.title: Transfer to Colombo Airport
activities.description: 3-hour drive north along the coastal expressway from Galle to CMB airport.

activities.title: Arrive at Airport
activities.description: Last-minute shopping at the duty-free. Pick up Ceylon tea, spices, and gems as souvenirs.
activities.tips: Grab a last Sri Lankan meal at the airport before departure.

activities.title: Flight JD488 ‚Äî Colombo to Beijing
activities.description: Julian's return flight. Departs CMB at 16:20, lands at Beijing Daxing (PKX) at 01:55+1 the next day.

activities.title: Julian lands at Beijing (PKX) ‚Äî Next Day
activities.description: Arrive back in Beijing early morning on Feb 22.
activities.tips: Book an airport hotel if you need rest before heading home.

activities.title: Flight CX612 ‚Äî Colombo to Hong Kong
activities.description: Cathay Pacific CX612. Red-eye departure from Colombo.

activities.title: Arrive Hong Kong ‚Äî Layover
activities.description: 7-hour layover at Hong Kong International Airport. Hit the Cathay Pacific lounge for breakfast and rest.

activities.title: Flight CX488 ‚Äî Hong Kong to Taipei
activities.description: Cathay Pacific CX488. Final leg home.

activities.title: Land at Taipei (TPE)
activities.description: Arrive back in Taipei. Trip complete!

sections.title: Visa Requirements
sections.content: Taiwan passport holders can obtain a 30-day ETA (Electronic Travel Authorization) online before departure. Apply at least 3 days before travel at www.eta.gov.lk. Cost is approximately USD 50. Passport must be valid for at least 6 months from entry date.

sections.title: What to Pack
sections.content: Light, breathable clothing (tropical climate, 27-32¬∞C). Modest clothing for temple visits ‚Äî shoulders and knees must be covered. Comfortable walking shoes for ruins and trails. Rain jacket or small umbrella (February is relatively dry but occasional showers occur). Sunscreen SPF 50+, insect repellent, and a reusable water bottle.

sections.title: Currency & Budget
sections.content: Sri Lankan Rupee (LKR). As of Feb 2026, roughly 1 USD = 320 LKR. ATMs widely available in cities; Visa/Mastercard accepted at hotels and larger restaurants. Cash preferred for tuk-tuks, street food, and smaller shops. Budget roughly USD 50-80/day for mid-range travel (meals, transport, entrance fees).

sections.title: Health & Safety
sections.content: No mandatory vaccinations, but Hepatitis A and Typhoid recommended. Drink bottled or filtered water only. Mosquito repellent advised ‚Äî dengue is present year-round. Travel insurance strongly recommended. Emergency number: 119 (police), 110 (ambulance).

sections.title: SIM Card & Internet
sections.content: Purchase a local SIM at Bandaranaike Airport arrivals. Dialog or Mobitel offer tourist data packages ‚Äî 15GB for ~USD 5. Coverage is excellent in cities and along major routes. Most hotels and caf√©s have free WiFi.

sections.title: Getting Around
sections.content: Hire a private driver for intercity travel (most cost-effective for 2 people, ~USD 50-70/day). Trains are scenic but slow ‚Äî book first class for Kandy-Ella route. Tuk-tuks for short trips within cities (negotiate fare beforehand or use PickMe app). Uber operates in Colombo.

sections.title: Brief History
sections.content: Sri Lanka's recorded history spans over 3,000 years. The island was known as Ceylon during British colonial rule (1815-1948). Ancient kingdoms left behind remarkable ruins at Anuradhapura and Polonnaruwa, both UNESCO World Heritage Sites. The island gained independence in 1948 and was renamed Sri Lanka in 1972.

sections.title: Customs & Etiquette
sections.content: Remove shoes before entering temples and homes. Dress modestly at religious sites ‚Äî cover shoulders and knees. Use your right hand for greetings and eating. Always ask permission before photographing people or sacred sites. Standing with your back to a Buddha statue is considered disrespectful. Greet locals with palms together ("Ayubowan" ‚Äî may you live long).

sections.title: Food Culture
sections.content: Rice and curry is the staple meal ‚Äî expect 5-8 small dishes served together. Hoppers (crispy bowl-shaped pancakes) and string hoppers are breakfast staples. Kottu roti (chopped roti stir-fried with vegetables and meat) is popular street food. Sri Lankan cuisine is spicy ‚Äî "not spicy" still has heat by most standards. Fresh tropical fruits are abundant: king coconut, papaya, rambutan, and wood apple. Ceylon tea is world-famous ‚Äî visit a tea plantation in the hill country.

sections.title: Language Basics
sections.content: Official languages: Sinhala and Tamil. English is widely spoken in tourist areas, hotels, and by younger generations. Useful phrases ‚Äî Hello: "Ayubowan" (Sinhala) / "Vanakkam" (Tamil). Thank you: "Sthuthi" (Sinhala). Yes/No: "Ow"/"Naha". How much?: "Kiyada?". Most signs are trilingual (Sinhala, Tamil, English).

sections.title: Wildlife & Nature
sections.content: Sri Lanka is one of the world's biodiversity hotspots. Home to wild elephants, leopards, sloth bears, and over 430 bird species. National parks like Yala and Udawalawe offer safari experiences. Whale watching season off the southern coast runs December-April (blue whales and sperm whales). Please support ethical wildlife tourism ‚Äî avoid elephant riding and facilities that chain animals.
